content:
Interesting discussion in the forum today.
https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/additional-css-classes-field-configure-block-window?page=0%2C0#comment-1630

Leads back to the discussion we've been having about "Who" we are building Backdrop CMS for, in terms of what kind of skill set or background do we expect someone to have to use Backdrop CMS to build a new site?

I haven't read this forum post but I was just thinking about "leaky abstraction" and how at some point it is hard to hide all complexity from end users. https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leaky_abstraction

"As systems become more complex, software developers must rely upon more abstractions. Each abstraction tries to hide complexity, letting a developer write software that "handles" the many variations of modern computing.

However, this law claims that developers of reliable software must learn the abstraction's underlying details anyway."
Interesting note. I have to think about this more...
